group_1.textLeft: I'd like ta ask ya something. Ya mind?

group_1.textRight: Only if I have an answer.

group_1.textLeft: So even you didn't expect anythin' like this.

group_1.textRight: As you may have imagined, what's happening@in Kamihama is irregular.
I'm unable to predict what will happen either.

group_1.textLeft: Well, I know you're not one ta lie ta me,
so I'll believe ya for now.

group_1.textRight: That's correct.@I never expected this either,
so I can't accurately suggest the best@course of action for now.

group_1.textLeft: Then let's get this sorted out.
All of the [textYellow:Kimochi] Stones have appeared and been@grabbed by Magical Girls from each group.
We've gotten that much outta this.
And it's expected that they're gonna be competin'@for the bracelets that hold the [textYellow:Kimochi] Stones.
In fact, Chiharu was targeted yesterday.
And since Kamihama is where the stage is set,@a lotta Magical Girls are fightin' there,
which resulted in all that energy bein' collected.

group_1.textRight: The results deviated too far from the calculations.
What will happen next is a small-scale battle@between a select few Magical Girls,
which means at first glance I can't expect@great results.
It is true that some girls were selected,
but I don't know how the conflict between@the remaining Magical Girls will work.
but there are other factors at play causing turmoil@in that city,
since not all Magical Girls there are straightforward.

group_1.textLeft: It's unusual for you to be havin' wishful thinking.

group_1.textRight: Wishful thinking?@I don't agree with that.
You humans are always so full of uncertainties...
...that you put me in situations@I would never expect.
So it's not wishful thinking.@This is a result of statistics.

group_1.textLeft: I see...@But, even if that's the case,
for me, it's more about hope.
